com.camerontec.catalys.core.session

Interface IFIXMessageReader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultFastMessageInputStreamReader, DefaultFixMessageInputStreamReader

    public interface IFIXMessageReader
    Interface to be implemented by implementations capable of reading IFIXMessages.

    Implementations are expected to layer on top of an underlying InputStream.

      • readMessage

        void readMessage(IFIXMessage message)
          throws IOException,
                 InboundValidationException,
                 GarbledMessageException
        Read an IFIXMessage.
        Parameters:
        message - The target message.
        Throws:
        IOException - On error reading from an underlying stream (if any).
        InboundValidationException - On encountering an inbound validation error.
        GarbledMessageException - On reading a badly formatted message.

        Close the underlying message source (e.g. stream).

      • setValidateOrder

        void setValidateOrder(boolean validateOrder)
        Parameters:
        validateOrder - If true then the reader should check field order

      • setConsume

        void setConsume(boolean consume)
        Instructs the FIX message reader to operate in "consume" mode.

        Normally it does not act in consume mode.

        In consume mode, incoming FIX messages are not processed at all. Instead basic statistics are written to standard output regarding throughput (average messages received per second) and latency (if messages contain a timestamp field).

        Because virtually no processing is done on the incoming FIX messages, a client operating in consume mode can act as an extremely fast client, useful in benchmark testing other FIX applications.

        Parameters:
        consume - True if we should enter into consume mode.

      • isConsumingMessages

        boolean isConsumingMessages()
        Return if the reader is operating in "consume" mode.
        Returns:
        true or false

      • setMaximumMessageLength

        void setMaximumMessageLength(int maxMessageLength)
        Set maximum message length
        Parameters:
        maxMessageLength - Maximum message length

      • setAllowNoLengthOnRawData

        void setAllowNoLengthOnRawData(boolean allowNoLengthOnRawData)
        Parameters:
        allowNoLengthOnRawData - allow no length on raw data
